data.title: Postal Codes of Nepal
data.meta_description: Province 1 Solukhumbu Solukhumbu D.P.O. 56000 Namche â€¦
data.text:
The Nepal Postal Service uses five-digit numbers as postcodes. The Department of Posts introduced the postal code system in November 1991. The first digit typically denotes a region. The district is indicated by the second and third digits. The post office is represented by the final two digits. Below is the list of postal codes according to province and district.

Province 1

Solukhumbu D.P.O. 56000 Namche Bazar 56002 Sotang 56004 Jubu 56005 Nele 56006 Necha 56007 Shishakhola 56008 Himganga 56009 Lukla 56010
